intro: Miquelia rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated miquelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Miquelia rostrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
